Contacts Management REST API Documentation¶

Welcome to the Contacts Management API documentation. This comprehensive guide covers all API endpoints and services.

Table of Contents

  • Configuration

  • Authentication

Main Application¶

async main.healthchecker(db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]

Check the health of the application and database connection.

Parameters:

db (AsyncSession) – Database session dependency

Returns:

Success message if healthy

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – 500 if database connection fails

main.root()[source]

Root endpoint that returns a welcome message.

Returns:

Simple welcome message

Return type:

dict

async main.startup()[source]

Initialize application services on startup.

Connects to Redis and initializes rate limiting.

Configuration¶

class src.conf.config.Settings(_case_sensitive: bool | None = None, _nested_model_default_partial_update: bool | None = None, _env_prefix: str | None = None, _env_file: DotenvType | None = WindowsPath('.'), _env_file_encoding: str | None = None, _env_ignore_empty: bool | None = None, _env_nested_delimiter: str | None = None, _env_nested_max_split: int | None = None, _env_parse_none_str: str | None = None, _env_parse_enums: bool | None = None, _cli_prog_name: str | None = None, _cli_parse_args: bool | list[str] | tuple[str, ...] | None = None, _cli_settings_source: CliSettingsSource[Any] | None = None, _cli_parse_none_str: str | None = None, _cli_hide_none_type: bool | None = None, _cli_avoid_json: bool | None = None, _cli_enforce_required: bool | None = None, _cli_use_class_docs_for_groups: bool | None = None, _cli_exit_on_error: bool | None = None, _cli_prefix: str | None = None, _cli_flag_prefix_char: str | None = None, _cli_implicit_flags: bool | None = None, _cli_ignore_unknown_args: bool | None = None, _cli_kebab_case: bool | None = None, _cli_shortcuts: Mapping[str, str | list[str]] | None = None, _secrets_dir: PathType | None = None, *, DB_USER: str = 'FastAPI_user', DB_PASSWORD: str = '147258', DB_HOST: str = 'localhost', DB_PORT: int = '5432', DB_NAME: str = 'FastAPI_HW', SECRET_KEY: str = '974790aec4ac460bdc11645decad4dce7c139b7f2982b7428ec44e886ea588c6', ALGORITHM: str = 'HS256', MAIL_USERNAME: EmailStr = 'fatsapiuser@meta.ua', MAIL_PASSWORD: str = 'pythonCourse2023', MAIL_FROM: str = 'fatsapiuser@meta.ua', MAIL_PORT: int = '465', MAIL_SERVER: str = 'smtp.meta.ua', REDIS_DOMAIN: str = 'localhost', REDIS_PORT: int = '6379', REDIS_PASSWORD: str | None = '')[source]

Bases: BaseSettings

Application configuration settings loaded from environment variables.

Uses python-decouple for environment variable loading and Pydantic for validation. All sensitive credentials should be stored in the .env file.

ALGORITHM: str
DB_HOST: str
DB_NAME: str
DB_PASSWORD: str
DB_PORT: int
property DB_URL: str

Constructs and returns the PostgreSQL database connection URL.

Returns:

PostgreSQL async connection URL in format:

postgresql+asyncpg://user:password@host:port/dbname

Return type:

str

DB_USER: str
MAIL_FROM: str
MAIL_PASSWORD: str
MAIL_PORT: int
MAIL_SERVER: str
MAIL_USERNAME: EmailStr
REDIS_DOMAIN: str
REDIS_PASSWORD: str | None
REDIS_PORT: int
SECRET_KEY: str
model_config: ClassVar[SettingsConfigDict] = {'arbitrary_types_allowed': True, 'case_sensitive': False, 'cli_avoid_json': False, 'cli_enforce_required': False, 'cli_exit_on_error': True, 'cli_flag_prefix_char': '-', 'cli_hide_none_type': False, 'cli_ignore_unknown_args': False, 'cli_implicit_flags': False, 'cli_kebab_case': False, 'cli_parse_args': None, 'cli_parse_none_str': None, 'cli_prefix': '', 'cli_prog_name': None, 'cli_shortcuts': None, 'cli_use_class_docs_for_groups': False, 'enable_decoding': True, 'env_file': '.env', 'env_file_encoding': 'utf-8', 'env_ignore_empty': False, 'env_nested_delimiter': None, 'env_nested_max_split': None, 'env_parse_enums': None, 'env_parse_none_str': None, 'env_prefix': '', 'extra': 'ignore', 'json_file': None, 'json_file_encoding': None, 'nested_model_default_partial_update': False, 'protected_namespaces': ('model_validate', 'model_dump', 'settings_customise_sources'), 'secrets_dir': None, 'toml_file': None, 'validate_default': True, 'yaml_config_section': None, 'yaml_file': None, 'yaml_file_encoding': None}

Configuration for the model, should be a dictionary conforming to [ConfigDict][pydantic.config.ConfigDict].

classmethod validate_algorithm(v)[source]

Validates that the JWT algorithm is one of the supported HMAC algorithms.

Parameters:

v – Algorithm string to validate

Returns:

Validated algorithm

Return type:

str

Raises:

ValueError – If algorithm is not supported

Authentication¶

Routes¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Confirm a user’s email based on the verification token.

Parameters:

  • token (str) – Email verification token.

  • db (AsyncSession) – SQLAlchemy async session.

Returns:

Message indicating whether the email was confirmed or already confirmed.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If verification fails or user does not exist.

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(NoneType), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Authenticate a user and return JWT tokens.

Parameters:

  • body (OAuth2PasswordRequestForm) – User credentials (email and password).

  • db (AsyncSession) – SQLAlchemy async session.

Returns:

Dictionary with access token, refresh token, and token type.

Return type:

TokenSchema

Raises:

HTTPException – For invalid email, unconfirmed email, or wrong password.

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Generate new JWT tokens using a valid refresh token.

Parameters:

  • credentials (HTTPAuthorizationCredentials) – Bearer token from the request header.

  • db (AsyncSession) – SQLAlchemy async session.

Returns:

Dictionary with new access token, refresh token, and token type.

Return type:

TokenSchema

Raises:

HTTPException – If the refresh token is invalid.

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Request a new confirmation email.

Parameters:

  • body (RequestEmail) – Object containing the user’s email.

  • background_tasks (BackgroundTasks) – FastAPI background task handler.

  • request (Request) – Current HTTP request.

  • db (AsyncSession) – SQLAlchemy async session.

Returns:

Message prompting the user to check their email.

Return type:

dict

Raises:

HTTPException – If user is not found or email already confirmed.

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserSchema, bt: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Register a new user account.

Sends a confirmation email after creating the user.

Parameters:

  • body (UserSchema) – User data for registration.

  • bt (BackgroundTasks) – Background task handler for sending email.

  • request (Request) – Current HTTP request.

  • db (AsyncSession) – SQLAlchemy async session.

Returns:

The newly created user object.

Return type:

UserResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If an account with the given email already exists.

Service¶

class src.services.auth.Auth[source]¶

Bases: object

Authentication service handling password hashing, JWT tokens creation and validation.

pwd_context¶

Password hashing context

SECRET_KEY¶

Secret key for JWT (from config)

ALGORITHM¶

Algorithm for JWT (from config)

oauth2_scheme¶

OAuth2 password bearer scheme

Noindex:

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶

async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)[source]¶

Create a JWT access token.

Parameters:

  • data – Dictionary containing token claims (typically user email)

  • expires_delta – Optional expiration time in seconds

Returns:

Encoded JWT access token

Return type:

str

Decode and validate a refresh token.

Parameters:

refresh_token – JWT refresh token string

Returns:

Email extracted from token

Return type:

str

Raises:

HTTPException – 401 if token is invalid or has wrong scope

Parameters:

  • token – JWT access token

  • db – Async database session

Returns:

Authenticated user object

Return type:

User

Raises:

HTTPException – 401 if token is invalid or user not found

Raises:

HTTPException – 422 if token is invalid

Parameters:

password – Password in plain text

Returns:

Hashed password

Return type:

str

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)[source]¶

Verify a plain password against a hashed password.

Parameters:

  • plain_password – Password in plain text

  • hashed_password – Hashed password to compare against

Returns:

True if passwords match, False otherwise

Return type:

bool

  • db (AsyncSession) – SQLAlchemy async session.

  • user (User) – Current authenticated user.

  • offset (int) – Number of contacts to skip.

  • db (AsyncSession) – SQLAlchemy async session.

  • user (User) – Current authenticated user.

Returns:

List of contact objects.

Return type:

List[ContactResponse]

Routes¶

Parameters:

user (User) – Current authenticated user (auto-injected via dependency).

Returns:

Detailed information about the authenticated user.

Return type:

UserResponse

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(file: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: AsyncSession = Depends(get_db))[source]¶

Update the avatar image for the current user.

Parameters:

  • file (UploadFile) – The image file to upload as avatar.

  • current_user (User) – Current authenticated user.

  • db (AsyncSession) – Database session.

Returns:

Updated user information with new avatar URL.

Return type:

UserResponse

Raises:

HTTPException – If there’s an error during file upload or database operation. Status code 500 for internal server errors.

Services¶

Email Service¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)[source]¶

Send a verification email to the specified recipient with a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • email (EmailStr) – Recipient’s email address to send verification to

  • username (str) – Recipient’s username for personalization

  • host (str) – Base URL of the application for constructing verification links

Raises:

  • ConnectionErrors – If there is an issue connecting to the email server

  • Exception – For any other unexpected errors during email sending

Example

>>> send_email("user@example.com", "john_doe", "https://example.com")
# Sends verification email to user@example.com with appropriate token

Cloudinary Service¶

async src.services.cloudinary.upload_avatar(image_path: str, public_id: str = None)[source]¶

Upload an avatar image to Cloudinary with automatic resizing and optimization.

Parameters:

  • image_path – Path to the image file to upload (can be local path or URL)

  • public_id – Optional unique public identifier for the image. If not provided, Cloudinary will generate one.

Returns:

Secure URL of the uploaded and transformed avatar image

Return type:

str

Raises:

Exception – If the upload fails or credentials are invalid

Example

>>> url = upload_avatar("user_photo.jpg", "user123@example.com")
>>> print(url)
"https://res.cloudinary.com/demo/image/upload/avatars/user123@example.com.jpg"
